newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft, MCI, BT to announce pact.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft, MCI, BT to announce pact.

text.p: Microsoft Corp, MCI Communications Corp and British Telecommunications Plc on Wednesday will announce an alliance to develop and market intranet services, a Microsoft spokesman said Tuesday.
The companies plan an announcement at 0500 EST/1000 GMT.

The Microsoft spokesman said the companies would announce an "an expanded alliance to develop a new suite of global intranet services" to be marketed by MCI and British Telecom. He declined to give details.
Microsoft already has close relations with BT and MCI, which last week announced plans to merge in a $20 billion deal.
In January, Microsoft and MCI announced a broad alliance to market and develop a range of online, Internet and networking services.
And in July, Microsoft and British Telecom said they would work together to market computer networking and online services for small and medium-sized companies.

Corporate use of the Internet and internal intranets based on the same standards has grown rapidly. Microsoft has promoted its BackOffice suite of applications and other software based on its high-end Windows NT operating system to meet such enterprise computing needs.
